snippet: As the bank became one of the nation's largest mutual fund managers, some current and former brokers say, it emphasized its sales over clients' needs.
abstract: As the bank became one of the nation's largest mutual fund managers, some current and former brokers say, it emphasized its sales over clients' needs.

byline.original: By SUSANNE CRAIG and JESSICA SILVER-GREENBERG

headline.main: Former Brokers Say JPMorgan Favored Selling Bank's Own Funds Over Others
headline.print_headline: Conflict Seen In Sales Tactic At JPMorgan
